definition: the tide rises, the boat floats (idiom); fig. to change with the overall trend/to develop according to the situation
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: As China’s economy has bounced back, wages have followed suit.
sentences.chinese: 随着中国经济已经出现反弹，工资也水涨船高。

sentences.english: Globalization was said to be the rising tide that would lift all boats.
sentences.chinese: 全球化曾一度被认为会带来水涨船高的效应。

sentences.english: The prices are now rising because of this mentality.
sentences.chinese: 而价格也随这种预期心理水涨船高。

sentences.english: Your job could be more secure and well-paid than ever.
sentences.chinese: 你的工作会前所朱有的安全，薪水也会水涨船高。

sentences.english: Vegetable prices rise during the journey from producer to consumer.
sentences.chinese: 在由菜农到消费者的环节中，蔬菜价格水涨船高。

definition: (of water) to soar/(of prices) to skyrocket
to surge up/to rise/(of tensions etc) to run high
to clamber up/(of prices etc) to rise
to skyrocket/to get quick promotion in one's career
to advance by leaps and bounds
to increase steadily/to grow with each passing day
(of prices, rates etc) to remain high
delicious cakes/popular person/sth that is in high demand
